# Blood pressure It is important to maintain optimal blood pressure at all times. Normal healthy humanoid has around [color=cyan]300[/color] units of blood and scanners will read it as [color=cyan]100%[/color] of blood level.
Blood level bellow [color=blue]90%[/color] ([color=blue]270[/color] units) is considered [color=blue]hypovolemia[/color].
Blood level above [color=red]110%[/color] ([color=red]330[/color] units) is considered [color=red]hypervolemia[/color].
## Hypovolemia [color=blue]Low[/color] fluid volume presence in blood. Or simply just [color=blue]blood loss[/color].
Causes: - Bleeding - Blood transfusion - Toxins
Symptoms: - Pale skin - Dizyness - Stuttering - Shortness of breath
Treatment: - Applying correct blood packs via IV methods until patient is no longer pale or reading blood level above [color=blue]90%[/color]. - Applying saline via IV. - Syringe injections instead IV is possible, but recomended. - Drinking big amount of water could also work as temporary solution.
## Hypervolemia [color=red]High[/color] fluid volume presence in blood.
Causes: - Unhealthy consumption of food and drinks - Administering chemical medication - Blood transfusion
Symptoms: - Constant minor nose bleeds - Dizyness - Slurred speech - Shortness of breath
Treatment: - Extract excess blood via IV and blood packs until patien feels no discomfort or reading blood level bellow [color=red]110%[/color]. - Extract excess blood via syringe. - Apply charcoal medication - Inflicting bleeding wounds is NOT a valid treatment for hypervolemia.
